inclusion.criterion: women 18 years and older who are either planning pregnancy or already pregnant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: currently meet criteria for stable remission from depression (defined as a baseline score of ≤ 9 on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD) and documented clinical remission for a minimum of six months prior to randomization)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: current or recent treatment with an antidepressant (stable dosage for at least the last four weeks)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: have a history of a major depressive episode
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: decide to discontinue antidepressant medication for pregnancy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: currently receive ongoing psychiatric care provided by a physician outside the MGH Center for Women's Mental Health, and written, informed consent.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: significant risk for self-harm or harm to others
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: meeting criteria for a primary SCID-I/P diagnosis of schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, an active eating disorder, dementia, delirium, or other cognitive disorder
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: presence of an active substance and/or alcohol abuse disorder within six months prior to screening visit
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: current use of mood stabilizers, antipsychotics or antiepileptics
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 16-year-old girl recently diagnosed with myasthenia gravis. She complains of diplopia and weakness affecting her upper extremities.
